title: IMDB JW player 8.25.6
content:
I don't know if it's a Setting or not. it's probably some kind of compatibility add on or extension issue. I discovered that on IMDB, the videos that play on the IMDB webpages for TV shows, etc, are going fuzzy some of the time. Sometimes they play normally, and then the next time they go fuzzy. I can provide video proof if necessary. By fuzzy I mean the picture breaks up, the colours are disrupted, the picture can't be seen. 

I tried everything. I discovered that these IMDB embedded videos are 'powered' by JW player 8.25.6. I discovered that JW player is a legitimate company that provides embedded videos for sites like IMDB.

This is an Asus laptop, it is brand new. I added a few other extensions like adblocker ultimate- and new tab tools, but in safe mode I found that this is not the problem. Please can you help! I did NOT have this problem on my previous laptop. Both laptops were running windows 11 with current updates. both have the latest Firefox mozillla browser. edinnick27 at hotmail dot com

title: Failed to fetch injected.js, Import failed 3 times. Final error: crypto.randomUUID is not a function
content:
I am having problems with a page on my local network NAS server. In console this message appears on every page I access:

Failed to fetch moz-extension://84d877f6-188e-f449-9e14-68b144dea3de/inline/injected.js, Import failed 3 times. Final error: crypto.randomUUID is not a function 

          inject-content-scripts.js:5:897

To check if it was my code I tried this simple html page (apparently the page has to be inspected so that the code appears):

Dumb Page

The page loads, but in console the above message appears. Also in my developing page using Bootstrap and jquery I have MANY CSS-related errors, starting with: Error in parsing value for ‘-webkit-text-size-adjust’. Declaration dropped. Unknown pseudo-class or pseudo-element ‘-ms-expand’. Ruleset ignored due to bad selector. Error in parsing value for ‘box-shadow’. Declaration dropped. .....(many other similar errors) My client environment is: Macos Catalina 10.15.7 Firefox 128.5.2esr (64-bit)

title: Missing Favicons in Bookmar Toolbar (Linux Mint)
content: Have been using Firefox 133.03 on Mint 22 Cinnamon for a couple of weeks now, but I have a number of randomly missing favicons in my bookmark toolbar. I have extensively googled the issue and tried pretty much all the remedies I could find: just click on the place holder icon to refresh, delete the bookmark and place it again, use the Checkmark extension, check the integrity of the favicon DB, delete the favicon and places.sqlite files, clear the cache. Doing these things repeatedly and repeatedly restarting Firefox, I could claw back a number of my icons, but now things have stalled and there a quite a few holdouts that refuse to update. I'm also using Firefox on Windows without these issues. Would appreciate some hints as to how to further troubleshoot this.
